definition: to call/to cry/to shout/to breath out/to exhale
variant of 呼[hu1]/to shout/to call out

sentences.english: The doctor asked to be paged if the patient's condition grew  worse suddenly.
sentences.chinese: 如果病人的病情突然恶化，医生让马上用寻呼机叫他。

sentences.english: I found a beeper on my desk. Is that yours?
sentences.chinese: 在我桌上我发现了一个寻呼机。是你的吗？

sentences.english: Find a beeper and deposit it on the origin.
sentences.chinese: 找到一个寻呼机和存款它的起源。

sentences.english: It is also very rude to leave a cell phone or beeper on during a movie.
sentences.chinese: 看电影时把手机或者寻呼机开着也是不礼貌的行为。

sentences.english: Please help! There’s a pager number.
sentences.chinese: 之后留了一个寻呼机的号码。

sentences.english: Pagers were zinging all over the room.
sentences.chinese: 房间里到处都有寻呼机在响。

sentences.english: A new field of application of this pager is developed.
sentences.chinese: 这种语数兼容寻呼机为其应用开辟了新的领域。

sentences.english: This is because the Supplier Name for Vegie-spread is misspelled.
sentences.chinese: 这是因为产品“寻呼机”的供应商名称被拼错了。

sentences.english: A man displays a smog forecast on his handheld pager, seen here.
sentences.chinese: 图为一名男子展示其手持寻呼机上的烟雾预报信息。

sentences.english: Review cell phone and pager use.
sentences.chinese: 检查所有手机和寻呼机的使用情况。

definition: cell phone (bulky, early-model one)/brick phone/mob boss
Personal Handy-phone System (PHS), mobile network system operating in China 1998-2013, branded "Little Smart"
electronic switching system (telecom.)/stored program control exchange (SPC)
